title.value: DIG In: Evaluating Disparities in Image Generations with Indicators for Geographic Diversity
title.justification: The title is extracted from the paper.
title.quote: DIG In: Evaluating Disparities in Image Generations with Indicators for Geographic Diversity

extractions.description: The paper introduces three indicators to evaluate the realism, diversity, and prompt-generation consistency of text-to-image generative systems when prompted to generate objects from across the world. These indicators enable automatic benchmarking of geographic disparities in state-of-the-art visual content creation systems.

type.justification: The paper conducts a comprehensive evaluation of geographic biases in text-to-image generative systems using proposed indicators.
type.quote: We use our proposed indicators to analyze potential geographic biases in state-of-the-art visual content creation systems.

name.justification: The paper focuses on evaluating images generated by text-to-image systems, which is a sub-field of Computer Vision.
name.quote: In this work, we introduce three indicators to evaluate the realism, diversity and prompt-generation consistency of text-to-image generative systems.

name.justification: The paper evaluates the performance and biases of text-to-image generative systems.
name.quote: Recent text-to-image generative systems such as Stable Diffusion (Rombach et al., 2021), DALL-E 2 (Ramesh et al., 2022), Imagen (Saharia et al., 2022), and Make-a-Scene (Gafni et al., 2022) have shown unprecedented quality.

name.justification: The paper's primary goal is to evaluate and highlight geographic biases in text-to-image generative models.
name.quote: Our comprehensive evaluation constitutes a crucial step towards ensuring a positive experience of visual content creation for everyone.

name.justification: Stable Diffusion is one of the text-to-image generative systems evaluated in the paper.
name.quote: Recent text-to-image generative systems such as Stable Diffusion (Rombach et al., 2021)...

is_contributed.justification: The model is not introduced by this paper; it is used for evaluation.
is_contributed.quote: Recent text-to-image generative systems such as Stable Diffusion (Rombach et al., 2021)...

is_executed.justification: The model is executed to generate images for evaluation in the study.
is_executed.quote: We then use the indicators to evaluate widely used state-of-the-art text-to-image generative systems. These include two versions of latent diffusion models (Rombach et al., 2021)...

is_compared.justification: The model's performance is compared to other state-of-the-art models in the paper.
is_compared.quote: We use our proposed indicators to analyze potential geographic biases in state-of-the-art visual content creation systems.

name.justification: LAION-2B-en is analyzed for biases in training data.
name.quote: In a small experiment, we prompt using Arabic, Hausa, and Zulu, which correspond to the most spoken non-English languages in the three African countries best represented in the GeoDE dataset (Egypt, Nigeria, and South Africa, respectively).

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific referenced paper title was found for LAION-2B-en.
